intro: Psilocarphus tenellus var. tenellus, commonly known as the slender psilocarphus, is a rare and delicate plant species belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
